Great progress! Now the tests are running. There's just one test failing because of a missing BouncyCastle dependency. Let me check the SSL test:

The SSL test is using Netty's self-signed certificate generation which requires BouncyCastle in Java 17. Let me check what Netty version is being used and if we need to add BouncyCastle as a test dependency:
[INFO] |     |        \- org.bouncycastle:bcprov-jdk15on:jar:1.52:test
BouncyCastle is there but it's version 1.52. The issue is that Netty requires a higher version of BouncyCastle that includes the cert package. Let me check the dependencies more carefully:

[INFO] |     |  \- org.apache.kerby:token-provider:jar:1.0.1:test
[INFO] |     |     \- com.nimbusds:nimbus-jose-jwt:jar:3.10:test
[INFO] |     |        +- net.minidev:json-smart:jar:1.3.1:test
[INFO] |     |        \- org.bouncycastle:bcprov-jdk15on:jar:1.52:test
[INFO] |     \- org.apache.kerby:kerb-admin:jar:1.0.1:test
[INFO] |        +- org.apache.kerby:kerb-server:jar:1.0.1:test
[INFO] |        |  \- org.apache.kerby:kerb-identity:jar:1.0.1:test

The issue is that the old bouncycastle version (bcprov-jdk15on:1.52) doesn't include the X.509 certificate classes that Netty needs. We need to add a newer version of BouncyCastle with the bcpkix artifact for test scope. Let me add it to the pom.xml:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.

            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcpkix-jdk15on</artifactId>
            <version>1.70</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
</project>
